data.title: Freeze Frame: Inside Hollywood's friendliest divorce between Bruce Willis and Demi Moore
data.meta_description: Demi Moore and Bruce Willis tied the knot in 1987 just a few months after first meeting and welcomed three ...
data.text:
Celebrity divorces are rarely amicable. But one Hollywood power couple bucked tradition in the early '00s with their enviably diplomatic split.

Demi Moore and Bruce Willis tied the knot in 1987 just a few months after first meeting and welcomed three children during their 13-year marriage.

By all accounts, their time together was mostly marital bliss. Moore and Willis had three daughters; Rumer, Scout and Tallulah and appeared to be tinsel town's most wholesome A-list family.

Which is why it came as a shock in 1999 when the couple announced their separation. However, what followed may have inspired the curiosity of their family, friends and fans even more.

Moore and Willis' divorce was finalised in 2000, however their split news didn't ignite a year of mud-slinging headlines and ugly prenuptial agreement leaks.

Instead, the pair remained close friends, openly speaking about their post-marriage adoration for each other as they continued to co-parent their three children.

"I still love Demi. We're very close," Willis told Rolling Stone in 2000. "We have three children whom we will continue to raise together, and we're probably as close now as we ever were."

Emma Stone and ex Kieran Culkin reunite in backstage moment

The Die Hard star added: "Our friendship continues. The institution has been set aside … It's difficult to live your life and marriage under a magnifying glass, which is what happens to movie star couples."

Moore echoed this sentiment with a line in her memoir, Inside Out. "It's a funny thing to say, but I'm very proud of our divorce," she wrote, referring to her longtime friendship with Willis.

There was undeniable proof of Moore and Willis' friendly relationship in 2003, when the Ghost actress began dating actor Ashton Kutcher.

Moore and Kutcher, who had a 15-year age difference, met in 2003 and debuted their relationship on a red carpet shortly after.

Though their age-gap was the talk of the town, Moore was determined no-one could speculate about the status of her relationship with her ex-husband.

Over the course of her relationship and subsequent marriage to Kutcher, the trio – Moore, Willis and Kutcher – were pictured together countless times.

Willis joined his ex-wife and her new beau at several red carpet events, often with their three daughters in tow.

Their blended family appeared to be the picture-perfect image of a happy divorce.

In June 2003, the whole clan were pictured at the premiere of Charlie's Angels 2 - Full Throttle, a moment that both debuted Moore's new romance and proved to the media that Willis was happy with the arrangement.

The unlikely trio were also snapped in 2004 enjoying the festivities at Willis' 49th birthday.

By 2008, Willis' new wife Emma Heming Willis had joined the family and appeared at many red carpet events with her new husband, his ex-wife and her new husband.

It was an unconventional picture, particularly when it comes to Hollywood, but for some time, it seemed to work.

That is, until 2011 when Moore and Kutcher's marriage came to an end. The couple had been married for six years and had lost a child to miscarriage during that time.

Their split also resulted in several revelations about their romance, including how Kutcher really felt being thrust into a blended family.

READ MORE: Moment in 1998 that made Matt Damon and Ben Affleck Hollywood stars

Kutcher would later speak openly about the experience of having three stepchildren at the age of 26.

"I was 26, bearing the responsibility of an 8-year-old, a 10-year-old, and a 12-year-old," Kutcher told Esquire in January 2023. "That's how some teen parents must experience their 20s."

He added: "Nothing makes you feel like a failure like divorce."

The Willis children also later admitted they weren't too fond of their parents' divorce and the young age of their new "step dad".

"It was definitely weird for a minute, but I have to commend him," Rumer told Howard Stern in 2015. "He was a really great stepfather. The perspective switched quickly."

The Willis-Moore family, while temporarily frayed by divorce, have now banded together stronger than ever after news of the actor's battle with dementia and aphasia.

In March 2022, Bruce Willis' family announced that the actor had been diagnosed with aphasia, a condition that affects language and communication abilities.

After a career in film spanning over 40 years, the actor revealed he would not be returning to the big screen due to his declining health.

"The focus for Bruce is to keep him active. He has a busy schedule with activities every day.
